title: Can Ekko do this?
body:
Hey guys,

I was wondering if this was possible since Ekko’s Q is basically a boomerang skillshot.

So as Ahri you can spit out your Orb, move somewhere and it will come back to you.
As Sivir you can also do the same with her boomerang.

You can also do this like, you throw it out, click a Thresh Lantern and if you chuck it away from an enemy, click the lantern to go past and the skillshot comes back, it will still deal the damage.

I’ve also seen Varus Qs damaging twice if the flash into it again after they got hit (extremely rare).




So can Ekko like, if he’s getting chased, chuck out his Q behind him to slow them, as it comes back to him, his R ‘shadow’ is directly behind your enemy so they get damaged by the outgoing damage, coming back damage and since you blink back will the coming back damage hit them again, thus damaging them again?

I was thinking of a rare case of an ultimate damaging combo of Ekko, you get chased, you W to where you think they will be, Q backwards, E away from them to buy time for your returning Q which damages again, blink back with ultimate to deal damage and for Q to come damaging again and then easily proc your E again since you casted it earlier.

Is this possible? Will Q deal damage 3 times to a single target?

It doesn't work, I've been trying for a flat 9 hours yesterday and the Q only procs twice. 

My theory is that because when you use your ultimate it is not a teleport like shen's ultimate or katarina E. Rather you are traveling backwards in time and thus when you jump back through your Q path the Q simply disappears as you pass it rendering the entire idea useless. But that is just my theory.
Logic doesn't apply because Corkie and Anivia still gets snared by Caitlyn's traps.
Ahaha those aren't skills, rather they are still in the terms of league "walking"
so you're going to blow your ult on the sole purpose of making your Q hit an extra time, lel.
